Ratios Tables

Mission 13: Ratios Tables

[SYSTEM NOTIFICATION] A C-Rank Gate has been detected. Difficulty: Data Analysis. Hunter, prepare to map the Ratio Dimension!

The Challenge Awaits

Young Hunter, patterns are everywhereâ€”in monster spawns, loot drops, and resource distribution. Today you learn to organize these patterns into tables and visualize them on graphs.

By plotting ratios on a coordinate plane, you'll see relationships that others miss. This is how elite Hunters predict dungeon behavior!

âš”ï¸ Hunter's Arsenal (Gear Checklist)

Gather these exact items before entering the Gate: - Paper, pencils, pens or markers - Ruler - Colored pom poms (or colored candies, buttons, or LEGO bricks) - Graph paper

ğŸ¯ Mission Objectives

Upon completion of this Gate, you will have unlocked: - Ratio Reasoning - Solve word problems involving rates and ratios (6.RP.3a) - Table Creation - Make tables of equivalent ratios and find missing values (6.RP.3a) - Coordinate Plotting - Plot ratios on a coordinate plane (6.RP.3a)

ğŸ“– The Hunter's Knowledge (Brain Download)

What is a Ratio Table?

A ratio table shows equivalent ratiosâ€”ratios that represent the same relationship:

Red Pom Poms : Blue Pom Poms
    2        :     1
    4        :     2
    6        :     3
    8        :     4

All of these are equivalent! (2:1 ratio)

Building a Ratio Table

Start with your base ratio and multiply:

Base ratio: 3 Red : 2 Blue

Ã—1 â†’  3 : 2
Ã—2 â†’  6 : 4
Ã—3 â†’  9 : 6
Ã—4 â†’ 12 : 8
Ã—5 â†’ 15 : 10

Plotting Ratios on a Graph

Each row of your table becomes a point (x, y):

   â”‚
 8 â”¤         â€¢ (8,4)
   â”‚
 6 â”¤      â€¢ (6,3)
   â”‚
 4 â”¤   â€¢ (4,2)
   â”‚
 2 â”¤ â€¢ (2,1)
   â”‚
   â””â”€â”´â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”´â”€â”€â”¤
     2  4  6  8 10 12 14   Red

The points form a straight line!
That's the pattern of equivalent ratios.

Video Lessons: - Completing Tables of Equivalent Ratios | CK-12 Foundation - Constructing Tables of Equivalent Ratios | CK-12 Foundation - Comparing Ratios with Tables | CK-12 Foundation

ğŸ—¡ï¸ The Quest (Activity)

ğŸ“œ Verbatim Instructions:

Make tables of equivalent ratios relating quantities with whole-number measurements, find missing values in the tables, and plot the pairs of values on the coordinate plane. Use tables to compare ratios.

Using the information gathered for the pom pom graphs, make a table to compare the ratios of various pom pom colors. Next, make a table with equivalent ratios. Imagine that there were triple or quadruple the number of pom poms and find the equivalent ratios.

ğŸ’¡ Hunter's Strategy Guide

Phase 1: Sort Your Pom Poms

Count by color:
ğŸ”´ Red: 4
ğŸ”µ Blue: 2
ğŸŸ¡ Yellow: 6
ğŸŸ¢ Green: 3

Phase 2: Find Ratios

Red to Blue = 4:2 = 2:1 (simplified)
Yellow to Green = 6:3 = 2:1 (simplified)

Interesting! Both ratios are the same!

Phase 3: Build a Ratio Table

Phase 5: Find Missing Values

If Red = 10, what is Blue?

Look at the pattern: Blue = Red Ã· 2
Blue = 10 Ã· 2 = 5

Check: 10:5 = 2:1 âœ“

Claude Code Training

[TRAINING PROTOCOL ACTIVATED]
Before attempting the assignment, you must train with your AI companion. Claude will guide you through the concepts and verify your understanding.

Step 1: Open Your Terminal

Open a terminal on your computer and run this command to start Claude Code:

claude --dangerously-skip-permissions

Step 2: Summon Your Guide

Copy and paste this prompt to begin your training:

Hey Claude, I'm Hunter Hyro on Mission 13 about ratio tables and coordinate planes.
I need to master equivalent ratios before my graphing assignment.

Be my training guide and:
1. Explain what makes ratios "equivalent" (same relationship)
2. Show me how to build a ratio table by multiplying both parts
3. Give me 3 problems finding missing values in ratio tables
4. Quiz me by having me create a table, plot the points, and describe the pattern
5. Have me explain why equivalent ratios form a straight line through the origin

Only tell me "Quest Unlocked" when I truly understand. Don't let me skip ahead!
Start with a simple ratio like 2:3 and build a table together.

Step 3: Complete Your Training

Work through all phases with Claude:

  • Phase 1: Learn the concept (Claude explains)
  • Phase 2: Answer checkpoint questions
  • Phase 3: Complete 3 skill trials
  • Phase 4: Pass the Boss Challenge
  • Phase 5: Teach the concept back to Claude

You cannot proceed until Claude says "Quest Unlocked"!

ğŸ“¤ Proof of Completion

Submit your evidence: - Video of you doing the activity, OR - Picture/scan of your written work

The System awaits your proof, Hunter.

Hunter's Wisdom: When equivalent ratios are plotted, they ALWAYS form a straight line passing through the origin (0,0). If your points don't line up, double-check your calculations!
